page.title: Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Cagayan de Oro

rev.comment: rm iconization of fair use images & this image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you.
rev.diff:
Line 44: Line 44:
Eventually four other archdioceses were established in [[Mindanao]] island: Zamboanga in 1958, Davao in 1970, Cotabato in 1979 and Ozamiz in 1983. Thus there are at present five ecclesiastical provinces in [[Mindanao]].
Eventually four other archdioceses were established in [[Mindanao]] island: Zamboanga in 1958, Davao in 1970, Cotabato in 1979 and Ozamiz in 1983. Thus there are at present five ecclesiastical provinces in [[Mindanao]].
â   â
[[Image:RevJames T.G.Hayes.jpg|185px|thumb|right|[[James Hayes (archbishop)|Most Reverend James T.G. Hayes]], the first Archbishop of Cagayan de Oro.]]
 
The first bishop and archbishop of Cagayan de Oro was the [[James Hayes (archbishop)|Most Reverend James Hayes, S.J., D.D.]], who established the Ateneo de Cagayan (now known as [[Xavier University (Cagayan de Oro)|Xavier University-Ateneo de Cagayan]]) and among others. He was succeeded by Most Reverend Patrick Cronin, SSC, D.D. in 1971. Bishop Cronin established the St. John Vianney Theological Seminary. The third bishop was [[Jesus Tuquib|Most Reverend Jesus B. Tuquib, D.D., S.T.D.]], who was installed as Archbishop with right of Succession on May 31, 1984, and became the [[Archbishop]] of the Archdiocese of Cagayan de Oro on January 5, 1988. Today, the current Archbishop is the [[Antonio Ledesma|Most Reverend Antonio J. Ledesma, S.J., D.D.]], who was installed on March 4, 2006.
The first bishop and archbishop of Cagayan de Oro was the [[James Hayes (archbishop)|Most Reverend James Hayes, S.J., D.D.]], who established the Ateneo de Cagayan (now known as [[Xavier University (Cagayan de Oro)|Xavier University-Ateneo de Cagayan]]) and among others. He was succeeded by Most Reverend Patrick Cronin, SSC, D.D. in 1971. Bishop Cronin established the St. John Vianney Theological Seminary. The third bishop was [[Jesus Tuquib|Most Reverend Jesus B. Tuquib, D.D., S.T.D.]], who was installed as Archbishop with right of Succession on May 31, 1984, and became the [[Archbishop]] of the Archdiocese of Cagayan de Oro on January 5, 1988. Today, the current Archbishop is the [[Antonio Ledesma|Most Reverend Antonio J. Ledesma, S.J., D.D.]], who was installed on March 4, 2006.
